summary.p: [The two opinions on Gryn√§us' lecture about the Lord's Supper, by Leo Jud and Bullinger (No. 1550)], which Myconius received through Adam [von Bodenstein?], he initially passed on to Markus [Bertschi], but he would also like to read them himself in peace; has otherwise written extensively to Gwalther. Must go to church now; regards.

div.p: Greetings. I received all your writings from Adam and, while I was engaged in other matters, I gave them to Markus to read. He returned them the next morning, just as the courier was preparing to leave. Indeed, I have not yet read a single letter. I thought there would be no harm in keeping them a little longer, until I could read them at leisure. I have written about all other matters to Gwalther through the same Adam.
Now I must go to church. Farewell in Christ with your family and Theodor. Hastily, Basel, August 21, 1541.
To Lord Heinrich Bullinger, in his Lord.
